item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "God has no religion." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning..." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Yes, reason has been a part of organized religion, ever since two nudists took dietary advice from a talking snake." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Yes, the long war on Christianity. I pray that one day we may live in an America where Christians can worship freely! In broad daylight! Openly wearing the symbols of their religion... perhaps around their necks? And maybe -- dare I dream it? -- maybe one day there can be an openly Christian President. Or, perhaps, 43 of them. Consecutively." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee And I'll forgive Thy great big one on me." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "The God of the Old Testament is arguably the most unpleasant character in all fiction: jealous and proud of it; a petty, unjust, unforgiving control-freak; a vindictive, bloodthirsty ethnic cleanser; a misogynistic, homophobic, racist, infanticidal, genocidal, filicidal, pestilential, megalomaniacal, sadomasochistic, capriciously malevolent bully." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Reading is one form of escape. Running for your life is another." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A good library will never be too neat, or too dusty, because somebody will always be in it, taking books off the shelves and staying up late reading them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I haven't any right to criticize books, and I don't do it except when I hate them. I often want to criticize Jane Austen, but her books madden me so that I can't conceal my frenzy from the reader; and therefore I have to stop every time I begin. Every time I read Pride and Prejudice I want to dig her up and beat her over the skull with her own shin-bone." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Sylvaine add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book." -- Jane Smiley
